alert.note: Alert for Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 9:05AM EST until February 17 at 11:18PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard. * WHEN...From this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. The street at the mouth of Big Bottom Branch is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 21.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon to 6.3 feet Sunday morning. It will rise to 6.5 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.9 feet on 02/27/1962. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 4 PM EST Friday.
